qas.question: Who made up a majority of the people on the frontier?
Who forced peasant farmers to move to new settlements?
In what year did Han forces stop a joint Xiongnu-Qiang invasion?
Where were landowners encouraged to migrate willingly to?
How many commanderies in the new frontier were created by the Han court in the year 111 BC?

context: In 121 BC, Han forces expelled the Xiongnu from a vast territory spanning the Hexi Corridor to Lop Nur. They repelled a joint Xiongnu-Qiang invasion of this northwestern territory in <a2_0>111 BC<a2_0/>. In that year, the Han court established <a4_0>four<a4_0/> new frontier commanderies in this region: Jiuquan, Zhangyi, Dunhuang, and Wuwei. The majority of people on the frontier were <a0_0>soldiers<a0_0/>. On occasion, <a1_0>the court<a1_0/> forcibly moved peasant farmers to new frontier settlements, along with government-owned slaves and convicts who performed hard labor. The court also encouraged commoners, such as farmers, merchants, landowners, and hired laborers, to voluntarily migrate to <a3_0>the frontier<a3_0/>.
